intro: Hoya betchei, commonly known as the "Hoya with white flowers," is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, often variegated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Hoya betchei is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its ease of care and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a favored plant among succulent and foliage enthusiasts.
